result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Comply with all conditions of the Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul A Nielsen

records.addlTxt: Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement /s/ TBE 06/10/22

9:11 AM Defendant Paul A Nielsen in court.  Attorney Jerod Barkley in court for Paul A Nielsen.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Guilty 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1:  Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1) as a Domestic Abuse 968.075(1)(a).
Clerk directed to withhold entry of judgment of conviction(s) this date.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present but is in favor of the agreement.

ADA Dodge makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1:  
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement - 9 months
Comply with all conditions of the Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement filed by Atty Jerod Barkley (sent to Br 1 Judge on 06/07/22 to hold until 06/10/22 sp)
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
to Defendant with corrected bond for signature and to return to clerk of court for file
Defendant's Authorization for Attorney to Appear and Act
Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

(*Corrected 02-03-2022)
No contact with victim A.T.W. except by My Family Wizard or text message for the purposes of child exchanges.  *Unless there is a family law order that is after todays court date in this case, then it will be as per the family court order.

02:35 PM Defendant Paul A Nielsen in court with Attorney (Atty) Jerod Barkley. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond is set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
